Function reference

Fit oblique random survival forests (ORSFs)

Fit ORSF models using cox proportional hazards regression or elastic net proportional hazards regression to identify linear combinations of input variables.

orsf() orsf_train()
Oblique Random Survival Forest (ORSF)
orsf_control_cph() orsf_control_fast()
Cox proportional hazards control
orsf_control_custom()
Custom control of oblique decision trees
orsf_control_net()
Elastic net control
orsf_time_to_train()
Estimate training time
predict(<aorsf>)
Predict risk or survival
print(<aorsf>)
ORSF presentation

Interpret ORSFs

Use data from linear combinations of inputs to determine the importance of individual variables, the degree of interaction between pairs of variables, or the expected prediction from an ORSF model at a given value of one or multiple variables.

orsf_vi_negate() orsf_vi_permute() orsf_vi_anova()
ORSF variable importance
orsf_pd_summary() orsf_pd_ice()
ORSF partial dependence
orsf_summarize_uni()
ORSF summary of univariate information
print(<aorsf_summary_uni>)
Print ORSF summary

Example survival data

Datasets used in examples and vignettes.

pbc_orsf
Mayo Clinic Primary Biliary Cholangitis Data

Back-end functions

Techniques used by aorsf that may be helpful in other contexts.

orsf_scale_cph() orsf_unscale_cph()
Scale input data
